description: The options when calling the function worksheet.add_table. See website for further details https://xlsxwriter.readthedocs.io/working_with_tables.html

autofilter.description: to turn on or off the autofilter in the header row. It is on by default

header_row.description: to turn on or off the header row in the table. It is on by default

banded_columns.description: to create columns of alternating color in the table. It is on by default

banded_rows.description: to create rows of alternating color in the table. It is on by default

first_column.description: to highlight the first column of the table. The type of highlighting will depend on the style of the table. It may be bold text or a different color. It is off by default

last_column.description: to highlight the last column of the table. The type of highlighting will depend on the style of the table. It may be bold text or a different color. It is off by default

style.description: to set the style of the table. Standard Excel table format names should be used (with matching capitalization)

total_row.description: to turn on the total row in the last row of a table. It is distinguished from the other rows by a different formatting and also with dropdown SUBTOTAL functions. By default, FALSE.

name.description: default tables are named Table1, Table2, etc. The name parameter can be used to set the name of the table

columns.description: to set properties for columns within the table

items.description: to set properties for one column within the table

header_format.description: the format for the column header

formula.description: column formulas applied using the column formula property

total_string.description: total captions are specified via the columns property and the total_string sub properties

total_function.description: total functions are specified via the columns property and the total_function sub properties total_function is a string among: average, count_nums, count, max, min, std_dev, sum, var

total_value.description: to set a calculated value for the total_function using the total_value sub property. Only necessary when creating workbooks for applications that cannot calculate the value of formulas automatically. This is similar to setting the value optional property in write_formula()
